title: Michael Douglas asked son to 'hand out joints at parties as a kid’, book claims
text:

Michael Douglas’ son Cameron has claimed the star asked him to hand out joints at celebrity parties when he was just a kid.

The now 40-year-old made the shock revelation in his new book that lifts the lid on his tumultuous relationship with his famous dad.

The tell-all memoir, titled ‘Long Way Home’, includes accounts of Cameron’s time in prison and his battle with addiction.

In one extract, he describes how he used to hand out drugs on his now 75-year-old dad’s orders.

Cameron revealed: “Even as a really young kid, I remember running joints back and forth.

"Dad would say: 'Hey, bring this over to your uncle' and I would, not realising until years later what it had been.

(Image: FilmMagic)

"As I got older, I would creep from house to house on the compound, climbing balconies and seeing more than I was supposed to: beautiful grown-ups doing the things that beautiful grown-ups living lives of excess do."

He added that his dad would take him for early morning breakfasts the morning after wild parties, but claimed that it was only as an adult he realised that those father-son outings were actually when Michael was coming down after a long night of partying.

(Image: GC Images)

Michael’s representatives have been contacted for comment on the allegations.

Michael and Cameron have had a strained relationship over the years, with Cameron arrested on drug possession in 1999 and again in 2005.

(Image: GC Images)

Two years later, officials found a syringe full of liquid cocaine in Cameron’s car, and it was around the same time that the troubled youngster was dealing crystal meth.

Cameron was sentenced to seven years behind bars, with Michael famously admitting that prison was the best chance for his son to get clean.

Cameron is Michael’s son from his first marriage to wife Diandra Luker, and the couple were married from 1977 to 2000.
